intro: Philippia mafiensis, commonly known as the Mafiensis philippia, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white to pale pink ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, linear leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, inconspicuous fruits that disperse its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Philippia mafiensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
